abstract: The former Merrill Lynch chief John A. Thain took aim at Bank of America over its statements regarding the $3.62 billion in bonuses Merrill awarded just days before BofA completed its acquisition of the Wall Street investment bank and brokerage on Jan 1.
lead_paragraph: The former Merrill Lynch chief John A. Thain took aim at Bank of America over its statements regarding the $3.62 billion in bonuses Merrill awarded just days before BofA completed its acquisition of the Wall Street investment bank and brokerage on Jan 1.

headline.main: Thain Says BofA Lied About Merrill Bonuses, Losses
